thread.title: Bonds weaker as equity rally continues
thread.title_full: Bonds weaker as equity rally continues

title: Bonds weaker as equity rally continues
text:
Thu, Aug 27, 2015, 4:58 PM AEST - Australia Markets closed Bonds weaker as equity rally continues AAP â€“ 8 minutes ago Print 
The Australian bond market has followed US Treasuries lower despite a top US Federal Reserve official suggesting a September interest rate hike is unlikely. 
William Dudley, head of the New York Federal Reserve Bank, said China's economic turmoil has eroded the argument for raising interest rates in September. 
"That only proved a small respite from a fairly solid amount of weakness overnight," RBC Capital Markets fixed income and currency strategist Michael Turner said. 
"That's also against the backdrop of recovering equities, which had a pretty healthy rally." 
The Australian share market gained 1.2 per cent on Thursday, while Wall Street gained almost four per cent overnight. 
At 1630 AEST on Thursday, the September 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 97.260 (implying a yield of 2.740 per cent), down from 97.315 (2.685 per cent) on Wednesday. 
The September 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.210 (1.790 per cent), down from 98.230 (1.770 per cent). 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.767pct, from 1.755pct on Wednesday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.783pct, from 2.733pct 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* September 2015 bill futures, 97.910, from 97.940 
* December 2015 bill futures, 98.060, from 98.090 
(*Closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
